etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in The Chemical Gazette. From French carbostyrile from carbo- + -styril (in styriline a base analogous to aniline: 1852 in the article cited above; from styr- (in styrole) + -iline (in aniline))

definitions: A crystalline compound produced by the oxidation of quinoline; any of the substituted derivatives of this compound, some of which have pharmacological activity.

notes.text: Carbostyril is a bicyclic lactim, systematic name 2-hydroxyquinoline. Formula: C₉H₇NO.
